Expectation2: Adhere to site protocols and work effectively as part of the team.
Situation2: The site-wide evacuation alarm has just sounded, and you must stop everything and proceed to the muster point immediately.
Story: My phone buzzed in my pocket just as the piercing evacuation alarm blared across the construction site. I glanced at the screen—my friend, Jamie, had replied to my earlier text, but the message was curt and hurt. I realized instantly that my joke hadn’t landed, and now Jamie thought I was upset with him. I knew I should call him right away, clear things up before the misunderstanding grew. But the foreman’s voice cut through the chaos, shouting for everyone to drop their tools and head to the muster point. Site rules were strict: no calls, no delays, just move. My heart pounded as I stared at my phone, torn between the urgent need to reassure my friend and the non-negotiable demand to follow safety protocols. I could already feel the weight of both expectations pressing down on me, my hand frozen between my pocket and my hard hat, as the crowd surged toward the exit.
